title: Strava puts popular โYear in Sportโ recap behind an $80 paywall
summary: Stravaโs most viral feature is suddenly locked away.
body: Earlier this month, Strava, the popular fitness-tracking app, released its annual โYear in Sportโ wrap-upโa cutesy, animated series of graphics summarizing each userโs athletic achievements. But this year, for the first time, Strava made this feature available only to users with subscriptions ($80 per year), rather than making it free to everyone, as it had been historically since the reviewโs debut in 2016. This decision has roiled numerous Strava users, particularly those who have relished the appโs social encouragement features. One Strava user in India, Shobhit Srivastava, โ begged โ Strava to โlet the plebs see their Year in Sport too, please.โ He later explained to Ars that having this little animated video is more than just a collection of raw numbers. Read full article Comments
